member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.IModalStackNavigator
member.summary: This represents a modal navigation stack in the context of a sections navigator. It's a modal of an .

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.IModalStackNavigator.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority of the modal.
member.remarks: The priority defines the precedence when there are multiple modals. The modal with the highest priority is the one returned by .

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.IModalStackNavigator.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this navigator stack.
member.remarks: This is used for mapping purposes.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.IModalStackNavigator.CloseModalTransitionInfo
member.summary: Gets the default transition info for the future close modal operation.

member.remarks: This class forwards all method calls to . The purpose of this class is to offer the same extensions on , but in the namespace.

member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ISectionsNavigator
member.summary: This represents a navigator that has multiple navigation stacks.

member.name: M:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ISectionsNavigator.OpenModal(System.Threading.CancellationToken,Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest)
member.summary: Creates and opens a new modal. Calling this adds an item in .
member.param: The cancellation token; note that cancellation is checked only at the very start of the execution.
The request containing the parameters for the new modal.

member.name: M:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ISectionsNavigator.SetActiveSection(System.Threading.CancellationToken,Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest)
member.summary: Sets the active section. The active section is the one a user currently interacts with. Modals are displayed on top of sections. The inactive sections can still be interacted with programmatically.
member.param: The cancellation token; note that cancellation is checked only at the very start of the execution.
The request containing the section name to set as active.
member.returns: The active section after the set operation.

member.name: M:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ISectionsNavigator.CloseModal(System.Threading.CancellationToken,Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest)
member.summary: Closes a modal.
member.param: The cancellation token; note that cancellation is checked only at the very start of the execution.
The request containing the modal priority.

member.summary: Notifies changes related to the property.

member.name: M:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorExtensions.NavigateBackOrCloseModal(Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ISectionsNavigator,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes back action depending on top-most frame state.
member.remarks:
Priorities:
Navigates back within the modal, if possible.
Closes the modal, if possible.
Navigates back within a section.
This is useful when dealing with hardware back buttons.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.RequestType
member.summary: Gets the type of section navigator request that this instance represents. This value indicates which other properties are meaningful for this instance.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.SectionName
member.summary: Gets the name of the associated with this request. This is null when this request is assocated with a modal.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.ModalName
member.summary:
Gets the name of the associated with this request.
When setting this to null and opening a modal, a generated name will be used.
When setting this to null and closing a modal, the will be used to find the modal.
This is null when this request is associated with a non-modal section.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.ModalPriority
member.summary:
Gets the priority of the associated with this request. The higher priority modals will mask lower priority ones.
When setting this to null and opening a modal, the current highest modal's priority + 1 will be used.
When setting this to null and closing a modal, the current highest modal's priority will be used.
This is null when this request is associated with a non-modal section.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.NewModalStackNavigationRequest
member.summary: Gets the for the newly created modal. This request is processed before the new modal becomes active.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.TransitionInfo
member.summary: Gets the for the operation.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.SectionsNavigatorRequest.NewModalClosingTransitionInfo
member.summary: Gets the for the future close modal operation of the newly created modal.
member.remarks: The open and close transitions should be correlated so it's very useful to define the close transition as you open the modal.
